page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Farming at this time is going through a very prosperous period with local farmers making a very good living as the following prices indicate: Dairy cows_ Â£550-Â£600:Store cattle_100p/per kilo which is Â£450-Â£600 each depending on breed and quality:calves_Â£80-Â£100:greyfaced gimmer lambs_Â£85-Â£109. Good hay cost_Â£110:straw_Â£50 potatoes_Â£50 and barley_Â£95 per ton. The local auction marts to which farmers take their stock are at Penrith, Carlisle and Kendal with seasonal sheep and fatstock marts at Lazonby,Troutbeck and Appleby.At these marts farmers buy in lambs either to fatten through the winter and sell for meat in the late spring or for breeding purposes..
